chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Antolin F Ojeda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

 No possession or use of mind altering substances, or illicit substances.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
ALL CONDITIONS CONCURRENT IN BOTH COUNTS

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antolin F Ojeda in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant Antolin F Ojeda in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New complaint filed this day 15CF199.  15CF199-special appearance by Atty Aaron Ojeda.  DE will stand mute.  Set for PH within 10 days.  PH 12-04-15 @ 1:30PM.    Court will order a $2500.00 sign bond, No possession or use of illegal substances, or illicit substances used to be mind or mood altering.  No contact with Christopher McClain.  

15CF84-Parties make argument to the court.  DE addresses the court.  Atty Olson believes there is 117 days credit.  Court will order one year jail on each count, concurrent.  DE may have huber for employment and treatment.  Reduce unpaid court costs to civil judgment.
Sentencing Memorandum, filed Atty Aaron Olson.
for court hearing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-01-2015 11:00 am
Case settlement
Has indicated does not intend to seek PCR.

Defendant Antolin F Ojeda in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Defendant Antolin F Ojeda in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time set for plea/sentencing hearing.  Agreement has been reached.  Court reads case settlement.  DE will get credit for time served in jail.  Attys are unsure of how many days but will get the calculation.  Court questions DE and tells DE his rights, DE understands.  Ct 3, NC plea.  Ct 1 will be dismissed but read in.  Ct 2, NC plea.  Court finds DE guilty.  Waiver of PSI has been made.  State will dismiss the uncharged case but will read in.  State agrees with agreement reached in this case.  Hoel also agrees.  Hoel states 34 days credit, State agrees.  Court will except recommendation of the parties.  DE will be placed on probation for 3 years.  DE will comply with standard AODA provisions, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol or drugs without a prescription, no bars taverns or liquor stores.  No possession or use of mind altering substances, or illicit substances.  DE must pay court costs.  Credit for 34 days jail.  DE must give DNA sample as a condition of probation.
